about_me.description: Studying Computer Science has taught me an important lesson that continues to be my approach to every challenge; start with building a solid foundation. For me, this is analyzing every issue until I understand it completely and feel confident using it. One of the reasons for my passion and why I welcome any opportunity to learn is the possibility to improve the technology and come up with creative solutions for exciting projects. As for my dreams and ambitions, my long-term goal is to become a full stack developer. My desire for the immediate future, however, is to work in a rookie friendly environment and build my career layer by layer.

education.faculty: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science

languages.name: English
languages.certificate: Cambridge Certificate in Advanced English Grade A

projects.title: Course Project for Advanced OOP
highlights: For this course, I implemented a multi-threaded chat, using Java and Swing
The requirements for the project specified that the users would be able to join the conversation by sending a request
In this way, only one person was allowed to write a message, while the others waited for their turn

projects.title: Web Application that resembles Twitter
highlights: This is a project that uses the MEAN stack, a collection of Javascript based technologies(MongoDB, Express.js, Angular.js, Node.js)
The result is a single-page web application, where authenticated users can post "tweets"

projects.title: Final year project/Dissertation
highlights: I am currently working on a website where users can collaborate to write stories or create alternate versions for other posted stories
It is written using Javascript and the MEAN stack
